net.medcommons.identity
Class Pool

java.lang.Object
  net.medcommons.identity.Pool
public class Pool
extends java.lang.Object

A synchronized FIFO. A fixed number of objects can be stored in a Pool. When the pool is empty, a consumer can wait for a specified time for another thread to put an object into the Pool. The intent is for this to be used for database connections, or worker threads.

Constructor Detail

Pool

public Pool(int max)
Create a Pool with a fixed number of objects.

Parameters:
max - maximum number of objects this Pool can contain
Method Detail

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Test if Pool is empty

get

public java.lang.Object get()
Try to get an object from the pool. Returns null if the pool is empty.

getWait

public java.lang.Object getWait()
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Wait indefinitely until an object is placed in the pool

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

getWait

public java.lang.Object getWait(long millis)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Wait a specified number of milliseconds of real time, if at the end that time the pool is still empty, return null. getWait(0L) is the same as get(): it will return immediately without yielding. To yield to another thread, try getWait(1L).

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
See Also:
get()

isFull

public boolean isFull()
Test if Pool is full.

put

public boolean put(java.lang.Object o)
Return an object to the pool. If the pool is full, this returns false.
